Replies.Author: Gene
Replies.Content:
Don‚Äôt worry about the links, apparently we‚Äôre already using 60% of the server and I think tinypic‚Äôs going to be our friend from now on.

I was a bigger fan of the ‚Äúfiller‚Äù shows between arcs in TWGOK. If there wasn‚Äôt so much exposition in the first couple of eps, we would‚Äôve skipped right to those. It gets off to a good start, and the satire ball does get rolling. Episode 4 is by far my favorite, with the glitchy dating sim. Then I play favorites with arcs, even if they feel a bit too strung out.

Trying to finish soredemo, I got most of the way in then sort of stopped. I‚Äôve got work to do man, being anime club president is hard work! I did watch Kuragehime, if only because it got picked up by funimation. No comment there, but you can _stream_ the rest of it if you so desire.

I sure do love video games. I‚Äôm glad I got to lose sleep over Amnesia again. God, pimpwalk‚Äôs a scary mofo. On a different note, everyone should try Daniel‚Äôs hard beat game. I‚Äôm the best at it, don‚Äôt let anyone (especially the creator thereof) tell you otherwise. Daniel, please continue to be awesome.

Replies.Author: Grant Walker
Replies.Content:
I‚Äôm looking forward to more TWGOK, if only to see if it really does pick up. Not that I doubt you. I‚Äôm sure it won‚Äôt take too much effort for the show to draw me in, as I started to like it the more I watched.

As for Soredemo and Kuragehime, I dunno. I want to give Kuragehime a chance, and having Soredemo around for some light fun every now and then wouldn‚Äôt be too bad.

I‚Äôll never be proficient at that game you guys were playing. Failing Dango Daikazoku on easy would make me cry.

Replies.Author: steve
Replies.Content:
Will you look at my painting?

FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU

And I agree with you Gene; the arcs were enjoyable to watch, but Keima and Elsie‚Äôs episodes were the best. I really liked the structure for the series where there was an arc, then an Elsie episode, then another arc, then another Elsie episode, then another arc, then Keima going God-mode. TWGOK was definitely one of the better shows from the fall.

also, @Jack‚Ä¶

Fuck you talking about terrible‚Ä¶ show of the season right there

Replies.Author: Daniel Pascua
Replies.Content: I‚Äôm still improving that game now. There‚Äôs some easier songs, and (since it seems to be too easy for some people‚Ä¶) a few harder ones too. üòâ When I finish up the standard game mode, I‚Äôm gonna do something that‚Äôs probably never been done with a rhythm game before! (Imagine simultaneously doing the rhythm game [which already has 3 screens] and a real time battle game‚Ä¶)

Replies.Author: Gene
Replies.Content: ITS LIKE MY DREAMS ARE COMING TRUE RIGHT BEFORE MY EYES

Replies.Author: Jack
Replies.Content:
\>\> _Hotori voiced by Hanazawa Kana_

‚Ä¶? Your sarcasm‚Äôs not being laid on thick enough here, mate (was that sarcasm?). Looking back on my top 10 list to ensure I didn‚Äôt actually claim this, I also realize I managed to mix up Aoi Yuki (who voices Tatsuno) with Chiaki Omigawa (who voices Hotori and P-ko). Derp.

God Only Knows was a fun watch. If I ever run dry on anime, I‚Äôll probably finish the rest of it (even though having more than a season‚Äôs worth of episodes usually makes me reticent to do so). Also, I am disappoint at richgirl‚Äôs kneesocks. She could have been a Grade S Zettai Ryouki if they had just added another 6-8 inches.

Kuragehime really banks on your liking (or at least tolerating) the setup you described. If you can‚Äôt/don‚Äôt like that (which is understandable), you probably won‚Äôt care for the rest. In case you care (spoilers) Tsukimi does _sort of_ wind up with Kuranosuke, if only because his brother gets involved in a blackmail affair with a bitchy redevelopment lady trying to earn their family‚Äôs political support after pretending to rape him. There‚Äôs a great scene with Kuranosuke pointing out to her that Shu‚Äôs a virgin and a picture of a flying unicorn popping into her head. However, the series ends before the relationship goes anywhere. Which was odd. (spoiler) Also, good point on the Game of Death/Kill Bill reference. I hadn‚Äôt remembered that, and was only reading off of tvtropes.

One more thing! For bad anime night, we should totally show Onii-chan no Koto nanka Zenzen Suki Janain Dakara ne!! Everyone will have a great time watching this truly awful anime. AMIRITE?

Replies.Author: Gene
Replies.Content: The funny thing is we somehow found worse anime than that.

Replies.Author: Grant Walker
Replies.Content:
‚Ä¶Wow. Pretty huge mistake on my part. Nope, that wasn‚Äôt sarcasm at all. I didn‚Äôt mean to imply you claimed Hanazawa was in Soredemo, but I guess I got confused, since Hanazawa played Tsukimi from Kuragehime, which is something you mentioned in your list. Somehow I definitely got things backwards.

So, yes: let it be known that Hotori was voiced by Chiaki Omigawa, not Hanazawa Kana. Don‚Äôt know what I was thinking there. MAH BAD GUYS.

I do plan on giving Kuragehime a fair chance, so I will watch more. Parts of the concept I do like, and like I mentioned above, there were jokes and references that I thought were pretty clever. Could say kind of the same for TWGOK.

Replies.Author: Chris
Replies.Content:
I remember watching the first episode of SoreMachi a while with Gene, thought it was pretty good, liked the soundtrack, and promptly forgot about it. It‚Äôs clearly a easygoing slice-of-life show, and while that isn‚Äôt bad, I think I‚Äôm a bit burned out of those kinds of shows. It could be something I‚Äôd watch an episode of at a time in between episodes of other stuff coming out this season. Dunno. Might look into getting the rest of it at some point.

TWGOK is something I sort of meant to watch last season after I heard it was pretty good, then forgot to. I‚Äôll probably watch it over this season when I get a chance (nabbing it now). I think it‚Äôs a pretty funny show, especially because I do the exact same thing Keima does when I watch RomCom/harem anime (‚ÄúOh, this character is x-archetype; her arc will probably go something like this‚Äù). I don‚Äôt find the characters particularly interesting, as they‚Äôre pretty vanilla (though that‚Äôs arguably the point), but it‚Äôs not bad, and it‚Äôs short.

As for Kuragehime‚Ä¶I‚Äôve got mixed feelings. It‚Äôs clearly trying to do something different from the rest of the shiny moe-centric anime around it, and that by itself somewhat intrigues me. On the other hand, I don‚Äôt know if the scenario is something I particularly enjoy. I might watch more down the road, but there‚Äôs other things I‚Äôd rather watch first.

And while Onii-chan is definitely terrible, Gene‚Äôs right ‚Äì there‚Äôs worse. Look forward to it.

Replies.Author: Grant Walker
Replies.Content:
I actually didn‚Äôt realize how very short TWGOK was. That makes bringing myself to watch it a lot easier, actually. Shorter shows are usually just easier to swallow.

I agree about Kuragehime. I sort of like the idea, but some parts of it just seem to be executed so, so badly. I don‚Äôt mind surprises in shows, but this one seems to keep surprising me the wrong way. Also, some of the jokes get old quickly (like the petrification thing).

And the promise of awful anime makes my inner flamesword (+1 against stuff I don‚Äôt like) flare anew.
